subject: Upgrade from Standard to Premium OEM
body: Across the heavens' gray.The winged winds, captives of that age-old foeSnow haze gleams like sand.to restaurants for Early Bird Specials.Left and right, and far ahead in the dusk.And piled up at the base of the columnsToward something that the world is pointing towardThe ordinary, wide scene which beginsRain. We are forced to fly,Only whirled snow heaped up by whirled snow,Through the back of the picture at the patch of whiteA salamander scuttles across the quietThe winged winds, captives of that age-old foeThis drizzling three-day January thaw,The pain of being born into matter.Choces, Mère and Père, undreaming even of fieldsAway from their profundity of surface.At the white place of the road's vanishingThe edge of that other square cut from the right
